subject: Programming
title: Abstract Data Types
description: A fast breakdown of Abstract Data Types for builders.

hook.text: A stack says 'last in, first out.' It doesn't say how â€” that's the implementation's job.

buildup.text: Abstract data types define what operations are available without specifying how they're built.

discovery.text: A list, a stack, a queue, and a map are all ADTs. Arrays and linked lists are implementations.

twist.text: The same ADT can have wildly different performance depending on which concrete structure backs it.

climax.text: Thinking in ADTs lets you swap implementations later without changing the code that uses them.

punchline.text: Define the what. Choose the how later.

quiz.question: What does an abstract data type define?
options: What operations are available, not how they work
